definition: Eastern barbarian/ancient ethnic group of northeast frontier of China
surname Dong
east/host (i.e. sitting on east side of guest)/landlord
surname Hu
non-Han people, esp. from central Asia/reckless/outrageous/what?/why?/to complete a winning hand at mahjong (also written 和[hu2])
beard/mustache/whiskers
see 衚衕|胡同[hu2 tong4]

sentences.english: Donghu is a branch of the Hu people who act actively in the Northeast of Yan.
sentences.chinese: 东胡是东周时期活跃于燕国东北面的一支胡人。

sentences.english: Chifeng area during the warring states period of DongHu.
sentences.chinese: 赤峰地区战国时期属东胡。

definition: Xiongnu, a people of the Eastern Steppe who created an empire that flourished around the time of the Qin and Han dynasties
Xianbei or Xianbi, group of northern nomadic peoples
ancient people of central Asia during the Han dynasty
Qidan or Khitan, ethnic group in ancient China, a branch of the Eastern Hu people inhabiting the valley of the Xar Murun River in the upper reaches of the Liao River 遼河|辽河[Liao2 He2]
Pu'yo, Korean Buyeo (c. 200 BC-494 AD), ancient kingdom in northeast frontier region of China
Turkic ethnic group
the Xirong, an ancient ethnic group of Western China from the Zhou Dynasty onwards/Xionites (Central Asian nomads)
chanyu (Han Dynasty name for chiefs of Xiongnu Huns 匈奴[Xiong1 nu2])
ethnic groups in the north and west of China in ancient times/foreigner/barbarian
Wuhuan (nomadic tribe)
Quanrong, Zhou Dynasty ethnic group of present-day western China
Goguryeo (37 BC-668 AD), one of the Korean Three Kingdoms
Tangut branch of the Qiang 羌 ethnic group/ancient ethnic group who made up the Xixia dynasty 西夏 1038-1227

Yan, a vassal state of Zhou in modern Hebei and Liaoning/north Hebei/the four Yan kingdoms of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Yan 前燕 (337-370), Later Yan 後燕|后燕 (384-409), Southern Yan 南燕 (398-410), Northern Yan 北燕 (409-436)
Tuyuhun, a Xianbei 鮮卑|鲜卑 nomadic people/a state in Qinhai in 4th-7th century AD
Huihu, Tang dynasty name of ethnic group corresponding to modern Uighur 維吾爾|维吾尔[Wei2 wu2 er3]
